title: How to Find The Height Of a Prism

steps.title: Set up the formula for the volume of a prism.
steps.content: Set up the formula for the volume of a prism. The volume for any prism can be found by using the formula V = A h {\displaystyle V=Ah} , where V {\displaystyle V} equals the volume of the prism, A {\displaystyle A} equals the area of one base, and h {\displaystyle h} equals the height of the prism. [2] X Research source The base of a prism is one of its congruent sides. Since all opposite sides of a rectangular prism are congruent, any side can be used as the base, as long as you are consistent in your calculations.

steps.title: Plug the volume into the formula.
steps.content: Plug the volume into the formula. If you do not know the volume, you cannot use this method. For example, if you know the volume of the prism is 64 cubic meters ( m 3 {\displaystyle m^{3}} ), then your formula will look like this: 64 = A h {\displaystyle 64=Ah}

steps.title: Find the area of the base.
steps.content: Find the area of the base. To find the area, you need to know the length and width of the base (or of one side, if the base is a square). Use the formula A = l w {\displaystyle A=lw} . To find the area of a rectangle. [3] X Research source For example, if the base is a rectangle with a length of 8 meters and a width of 2 meters, to find the area you would calculate: A = ( 8 ) ( 2 ) {\displaystyle A=(8)(2)} A = 16 m 2 {\displaystyle A=16m^{2}}

steps.title: Plug the area of the base into the volume of a prism formula.
steps.content: Plug the area of the base into the volume of a prism formula. Make sure you are substituting for the variable A {\displaystyle A} . For example, if you found the area of the base to be 16 square meters, then your formula will look like this: 64 = 16 h {\displaystyle 64=16h}

steps.title: Solve the equation for h {\displaystyle h} .
steps.content: Solve the equation for h {\displaystyle h} . This will give you the height of your prism. [4] X Research source For example, if your equation is 64 = 16 h {\displaystyle 64=16h} , you would need to divide each side by 16 to find h {\displaystyle h} .Thus: 64 16 = 16 h 16 {\displaystyle {\frac {64}{16}}={\frac {16h}{16}}} 4 = h {\displaystyle 4=h} So, the height of your rectangular prism would be 4 meters.

steps.title: Plug the volume into the formula.
steps.content: Plug the volume into the formula. If you do not know the volume, you cannot use this method. For example, if you know the volume of the prism is 840 cubic meters ( m 3 {\displaystyle m^{3}} ), then your formula will look like this: 840 = A h {\displaystyle 840=Ah}

steps.title: Find the area of the base.
steps.content: Find the area of the base. To find the area, you need to know the length of the triangle’s base and the height of the triangle. Use the formula A = 1 2 ( b ) ( h ) {\displaystyle A={\frac {1}{2}}(b)(h)} to find the area of a triangle. [6] X Research source Alternatively, if you know the length of all three sides of a triangle, you can find the area using Heron’s formula. [7] X Research source Read Calculate the Area of a Triangle for complete instructions. For example, if the base of the triangle is 12 meters, and the height of the triangle is 7 meters, to find the area you would calculate: A = 1 2 ( 12 ) ( 7 ) {\displaystyle A={\frac {1}{2}}(12)(7)} A = 1 2 ( 84 ) {\displaystyle A={\frac {1}{2}}(84)} A = 42 {\displaystyle A=42}

steps.title: Plug the area of the base into the volume of a prism formula.
steps.content: Plug the area of the base into the volume of a prism formula. Make sure you are substituting for the variable A {\displaystyle A} . For example, if you found the area of the base to be 42 square meters, then your formula will look like this: 840 = 42 h {\displaystyle 840=42h}

steps.title: Solve the equation for h {\displaystyle h} .
steps.content: Solve the equation for h {\displaystyle h} . This will give you the height of your prism. For example, if your equation is 840 = 42 h {\displaystyle 840=42h} , you would need to divide each side by 42 to find h {\displaystyle h} .Thus: 840 42 = 42 h 42 {\displaystyle {\frac {840}{42}}={\frac {42h}{42}}} 20 = h {\displaystyle 20=h} So, the height of your triangular prism would be 20 meters.

steps.title: Set up the formula for the surface area of a prism.
steps.content: Set up the formula for the surface area of a prism. The formula for the surface area of any prism is S A = 2 B + P h {\displaystyle SA=2B+Ph} , where S A {\displaystyle SA} equals the surface area, B {\displaystyle B} equals the area of the base, P {\displaystyle P} equals the perimeter of the base, and h {\displaystyle h} equals the height of the prism. In order for this method to work you must know the surface area of the prism, as well as the length and width of the base.

steps.title: Plug the surface area of the prism into the formula.
steps.content: Plug the surface area of the prism into the formula. If you do not know the surface area, this method will not work. For example, if you know the surface area is 1460 square centimeters, your formula will look like this: 1460 = 2 B + P h {\displaystyle 1460=2B+Ph}

steps.title: Find the area of the base.
steps.content: Find the area of the base. To find the area, you need to know the length and width of the base (or of one side, if the base is a square). Use the formula A = l w {\displaystyle A=lw} . To find the area of a rectangle. [8] X Research source For example, if the base is a rectangle with a length of 8 centimeters and a width of 2 centimeters, to find the area you would calculate: A = ( 8 ) ( 2 ) {\displaystyle A=(8)(2)} A = 16 {\displaystyle A=16}

steps.title: Plug the area of the base into the formula for the surface area of a prism and simplify.
steps.content: Plug the area of the base into the formula for the surface area of a prism and simplify. Make sure you are substituting for the letter B {\displaystyle B} . For example, if you found the area of the base to be 16, your formula will look like this: 1460 = 2 ( 16 ) + P h {\displaystyle 1460=2(16)+Ph} 1460 = 32 + P h {\displaystyle 1460=32+Ph}

steps.title: Find the perimeter of the base.
steps.content: Find the perimeter of the base. To find the perimeter of a rectangle, add up the length of all four sides, or, for a square, multiply the length of one side by 4. Remember that opposite sides of a rectangle have the same length. [9] X Research source For example, if the base is a rectangle with a length of 8 centimeters and a width of 2 centimeters, to find the perimeter you would calculate: P = 8 + 2 + 8 + 2 {\displaystyle P=8+2+8+2} P = 20 {\displaystyle P=20}

steps.title: Plug the perimeter of the base into the formula for the surface area of a prism.
steps.content: Plug the perimeter of the base into the formula for the surface area of a prism. Make sure you are substituting for the letter P {\displaystyle P} . For example, if you found the perimeter of the base to be 20, your formula will look like this: 1460 = 32 + 20 h {\displaystyle 1460=32+20h}

steps.title: Solve the equation for h {\displaystyle h} .
steps.content: Solve the equation for h {\displaystyle h} . This will give you the height of your prism. For example, if your equation is 1460 = 32 + 20 h {\displaystyle 1460=32+20h} , you would first need to subtract 32 from each side, then divide each side by 20. Thus: 1460 = 32 + 20 h {\displaystyle 1460=32+20h} 1428 = 20 h {\displaystyle 1428=20h} 1428 20 = 20 h 20 {\displaystyle {\frac {1428}{20}}={\frac {20h}{20}}} 71.4 = h {\displaystyle 71.4=h} So, the height of your prism is 71.4 centimeters.
